Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 2 for SLE 15 SP1)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 2 for SLE 15 SP1)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-197_7 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2019-13233: Fixed use-after-free for access to an LDT entry caused by a race condition between modify_ldt() and a #BR exception for an MPX bounds violation (bsc#1140454).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Live Patching 15 SP1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Live Patching 15 SP1

Vulnerabilities.Description: In arch/x86/lib/insn-eval.c in the Linux kernel before 5.1.9, there is a use-after-free for access to an LDT entry because of a race condition between modify_ldt() and a #BR exception for an MPX bounds violation.
